benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/tags - Remove tags from bundle

covered: Valid Deletion: Multiple scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC04, TC12, TC16) verify successful deletions, including deleting all tags, specific tags, large batches, and empty-array regression.
Empty Response: TC01, TC04, TC12, TC16 assert 204 and empty body behavior when appropriate.

Query Parameters & Validation: Scenarios cover valid tagDef usage, invalid tagDef (TC07, TC13), partial valid/invalid mixes (TC13), extra unexpected query params (TC11), and the empty-array tagDef regression (TC16).
Header Validation: Presence and absence of required headers tested (background sets headers; TC03 verifies optional headers, TC08 tests missing X-Killbill-CreatedBy).
Authentication/Authorization & Errors: TC09 covers unauthorized access, TC05 covers invalid bundleId format (400), TC06 covers non-existent bundleId (404), and TC10 covers service unavailable (503).
Concurrency & Performance: TC15 addresses concurrent DELETE requests for race condition detection; TC18 covers timeout behavior for extremely large datasets.
Security Input Validation: TC14 checks XSS/injection in headers.
Integration/Consistency: TC17 verifies data consistency after deletion via GET.
gaps: Soft Deletes / Deletion Semantics: No scenarios verify whether deletion is soft (flagged) vs. hard (physically removed) or how deleted tags are represented in audit/history.
HTTP Response Content-Type and Headers: Tests do not assert produced content-type (application/json) or caching / ETag / Cache-Control headers as noted in general guidelines.
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests for rate limit behavior or handling of bursts beyond the concurrency test (TC15 does concurrency but not throttling/rate-limit responses).
Idempotency & Duplicate Requests: No explicit tests that repeated identical DELETE calls are idempotent (e.g., calling twice returns 204 or appropriate response the second time).
Authorization granularity (403 vs 401): TC09 asserts 401 for unauthorized; there is no test distinguishing authenticated-but-forbidden (403) vs unauthenticated (401).

Malformed Headers / Header Validation Beyond X-Killbill-CreatedBy: While XSS header test exists, there is no coverage for invalid types/lengths for required headers or missing optional headers behavior beyond X-Killbill-CreatedBy.

Error payload format & localization: Tests assert existence of error messages but do not validate structured error payload fields (codes, error types, field paths) or localization/readability beyond accessibility TC19 (which is UI-focused).
Logging/Audit Trail Verification: No tests verifying that X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are recorded in audit logs or history.
recommendations: Add tests to verify deletion semantics: confirm whether tags are soft-deleted (and can be undeleted) or hard-removed; include checks on audit/history records.

Add assertions for HTTP response headers and content-type (application/json) and caching behavior (ETag, Cache-Control) even if the endpoint normally returns 204 — verify headers presence/absence per API contract.
Introduce rate-limiting/throttling tests: simulate request bursts and assert 429 or configured behavior, and verify graceful handling under load beyond functional concurrency (TC15).
Add idempotency tests: call DELETE twice and verify the second call behaves according to spec (still 204 or an appropriate error).
Differentiate authentication vs authorization tests: include both 401 (unauthenticated) and 403 (authenticated but forbidden) scenarios to cover access control nuances.
Expand header validation tests: include malformed/overly-long header values, missing optional headers, and verify server-side validation responses and logging.
Validate structured error response bodies: assert error schema (fields such as code, message, stack trace absence) to ensure clients can reliably parse errors.
Add audit/logging/integration tests: verify X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are persisted in change history and visible via relevant audit endpoints or DB checks.
